page.title: 12POST_WAR CAYTON AND OSGODBY
page.content: Up to 1945 the villages had a balanced population of mainly farmworkers and tradesmen. Then many retired people came to live here in new houses built for them. Light industries then came and 4 new estates were built for the young families who moved in. As the estates and families became older the population became more balanced again. The population changed little from 519 in 1821 to 850 in 1941,but rose to 3400 by 1981. The number of children at Cayton Primary School had the same pattern. In 1945 there were 70 children,rising to 326 by 1976 but falling to 230 in 1985. There is a lack of amenities;only 6 shops,no library,doctor,chemist or bank.The green areas have been filled in by houses and heavy lorries use the narrow main street.
